column2: A javascript timepicker plugin for jQuery inspired by Google Calendar.

Update jquery.timepicker.d.ts

Fix TypeScript error when using "noImplicitAny" compiler option

When using the "noImplicitAny" compiler option in TypeScript the missing type definition for "clickedElement" causes a type error. I assume, that the type of clickedElement is Element but am not sure. Even explicitly using the any type would resolve the problem and just leave the parameter untyped.

Use _ONE_DAY constant

Fix forceRoundTime with minTime glitch

If forceRoundTime is true, and a step is given, and minTime is set, an inconsistency can occur when minTime is not a multiple of step from midnight.  For example, consider the case of a minTime of 6:45am and a step of 6. The documentation says "Setting forceRoundTime to true will round the entered time to the nearest option on the dropdown list."  However, in the case given, the dropdown will have 6:45am, 6:51am, 6:57am, ... but the initial value will set to 6:48am and if I type in, say, 6:51am it will jump to 6:54am which isn't even one of the dropdown options.

Merge pull request #359 from 1337/bug/incorrect-formattime-input

Fix combined usages of step + forceRoundTime

Fix combined usages of step + forceRoundTime

When `setTime(Date value)` is called, `settings.forceRoundTime`
is consulted. This causes `_roundAndFormatTime(???, settings)`,
and subsequently, `_int2time(???, settings)`, to run.

Results:

```
>value
Fri Feb 27 2015 11:46:00 GMT-0500 (EST)
>_roundAndFormatTime(value, settings)
"3:40 PM"
>_roundAndFormatTime(_time2int(value), settings)
"11:45 AM"
```

Tweaked typeahead to better guess am/pm values

If a scrollDefault or minTime is set and no am/pm is provided when using 12-hour time, the scrollDefault/minTime will be used to guess am/pm. For example, if the scrollDefault is 10:00am and the user enters '5', timepicker will guess that means 5:00pm, not 5:00am. Closes #264

The scrollDefaultNow and scrollDefault options have been consolidated into a single scrollDefault option.

Merge pull request #228 from aschepis/scope-fix

Fix scope of loop variable when iterating defaults

Fix scope of loop variable when iterating defaults

When iterating over _defaults the `key` variable is not scoped. This
breaks compatibility with libraries that are trying to globally expose
a `key` variable or function, such as keymaster.js

Method calls to uninitialized timepickers will no longer produce JS errors

Fix for daylight savings issue

Adding _time2int(_getTimeValue(self)) to a unixtime assumes each day
is 24 hours long;  this is not always the case in regions that have
daylight savings time.

This change explicitly sets hours/minutes/seconds, rather than making
said assumption.

Removed duplicate wrapping of 'this'

For the methods option, getSecondsFromMidnight, getTime, setTime, and remove, 'this' is already a jQuery object, so $(this) in those methods is actually $($(this)).
See http://docs.jquery.com/Plugins/Authoring#Context

return self in option method to support chaining

Lets us do something like $('#timepicker-input').timepicker('option', 'option1', val).timepicker('option', 'option2', val).show();
